verses.verse: Moreover, brothers, we want you to know of God's grace given to the Macedonian churches.
[Despite having] a great test of affliction, the great amount of joy and their deep poverty abounded into the riches of their generosity,
for according to their ability, I bear witness, yes even beyond their ability, they were freely voluntary
pleading us with great urgency that we would take the gift and fellowship of sharing with God's people.
[They did this] not just we hoped for but first gave themselves to the Lord then to us through God's will.
We encouraged Titus that as he had started, so he would complete this same grace to you.
So since you abound in all faith, speech, knowledge, diligence, and love for us, [see to it] that you abound in this grace, too.
I'm not giving an order, but because of the eagerness of others and to prove the sincerity of your love.
For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that for you he--being rich--became poor, in order that you through his poverty might become rich.
So this is the advice I give because it is best for you who have started already a year ago, not only to do this but to also want to do it.
Therefore now get going and do it, so that just as there was a willingness to do it, now there can be a doing of it out of what you have.
For if at first there is a willingness, it is acceptable according to what a person has, not to what he doesn't have.
I'm not [suggesting] that others have it easier and you have it harder but keeping it equal,
in order that your abundance may meet their need and their abundance may meet your need, so there will be fairness.
Just as it is written, "He who had gathered much had nothing left over, and he who had gathered little had no lack."
Thanks be to God, who has placed the same concern into Titus' heart for you,
for truly he accepted our urgent appeal, but being even more earnest, he came to you of his own free will.
We have sent with him, the brother whose admiration in the Gospel [is known] throughout the churches.
Not only that but he was also chosen by the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is ministered by us to the glory of the Lord himself and your eagerness,
[and] to avoid a scandal, so no one would blame us for the large gift ministered by us
thinking ahead for what is honest not only in the sight of the Lord but also in the sight of men.
With them we are sending our brother, whom we have tested many times in many things and even now being very earnest because of his great confidence he has in you.
As for Titus, [he is] my partner and fellow helper whether towards you or our brethren, the messengers of the churches, the glory of Christ.
So prove it to them and the churches, the proof of your love and our boasting on your behalf.
